text: Most people are surprised to learn that this room
does not come from a Parisian residence of the Seventeen hundreds
but rather, a New York City townhouse built in the 1920's.
In it, you will find a carpet woven for Louis XIV,
the wall lights of Louis XVI's aunts,
and even a writing table once owned by Marie Antoinette.
Touch any object on the screen
or play a video to find out more.
or play a video to find out more.
